descriptionMarkdown:
This beaconed Kovarex setup has the following properties:

1. Works efficiently with or without productivity modules in the centrifuge, i.e., can detect the extra U-235 that appears every few cycles.
2. Tolerant of input materials getting cut off, i.e., will start back up again properly when they return.
3. Tolerant of output belts getting backed up, i.e., will prompty stop and then start up again when allowed.
4. Easy to start up -- place 40 U-235 in the proper chest (not in the centrifuge) and just let the U-238 come in on input belt.
5. No input materials will ever build up/buffer in the centrifuge or in the chests, i.e., it will only ever contain take in the input that it needs, and will expel any output that it doesn't need doesn't need to the output belts.  E.g., if excessive U-238 gets put into the centrifuge then it will be given priority over the ones on the input belt.

The reason for the complexity is mainly due to item (1) above, i.e., getting all of the desirable properties to hold both with or without productivity modules.  The combinators involved create the following:

1. One RS latch
2. One counter that goes up to 41 and then resets to zero.
3. Some decider combinators that translate inputs from the boxes/inserters into signals into the latch and counter.
title: Efficient Kovarex Process with Productivity Modules
